meanings.definition: To push, fold, or turn the edges or ends of something, especially fabric, in order to hide them or hold them in place.
meanings.sent1: She was tucking the loose ends of the tablecloth neatly under the table.
meanings.sent2: Mom was tucking the blanket around me before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten kept tucking its toy mouse under the rug.
meanings.sent4: He was tucking away his emotions, hiding them like secrets in a drawer.
meanings.sent5: The magician was tucking the colorful scarves into his sleeve, ready to surprise the audience.

meanings.definition: To put something into a snug or safe place.
meanings.sent1: The child was tucking her favorite teddy bear into bed.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel was tucking the acorn into a hole in the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The explorer was tucking the precious gem into a hidden pocket.
meanings.sent4: She was tucking her worries away in a cozy corner of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The bee was tucking the pollen into its pollen basket, ready to fly back to the hive.

meanings.definition: To secure or fasten something by tucking it in.
meanings.sent1: He was tucking his shirt into his pants before the job interview.
meanings.sent2: She was tucking the newspaper under her arm as she rushed out the door.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was tucking the nut securely into a hole in the ground.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was tucking the plant into the soil, ensuring it would grow strong.
meanings.sent5: The chef was tucking the napkin into the collar of his shirt, ready to cook up a storm.
